intro: Codonoboea castaneifolia, commonly known as the chestnut-leafed codonoboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves that resemble chestnut leaves, hence its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in its native regions.
